page.title: 10Fishing -The Fish Farm
page.content: There is a fish farm at Johnstonebridge where they rear rainbow trout from North America. They keep rainbow trout because they grow faster and are cheaper to feed than brown trout. The fish farm opened in 1977. Later that year there was very bad flooding in this area. The river overflowed and the fish were washed away and the local people were picking fish up out of the fields and puddles as the waters receded. The fish farm is owned by Annandale Estates as, are the fishing rights on parts of the river.
